newsitem.title: USA: No financial crisis seen in South Korea, Thailand.
newsitem.headline: No financial crisis seen in South Korea, Thailand.

text.p: Both South Korea and Thailand have significant financial sector inefficiencies but there is no reason to believe there will be a banking or other financial crisis in either country, World Bank East Asian Chief Economist Michael Walton said Friday.
"We don't expect there to be a banking or other financial crisis in either place," Walton told a briefing for reporters.
He said that the two countries had more balanced economic conditions than in countries where financial problems had deteriorated into crisis.
Walton also said he hoped revelations about financial problems in the two countries will lead to broad efforts to bring about structural reform, adding that steps are already underway.

"(South) Korea is in an intensive phase of looking at how to develop a liberalized financial system in the coming years (and) Thailand is in a phase of preventing institution-specific problems (from) leading to broader problems," Walton said.
